DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Plasma Aliquot Processing Person Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the person who processed the specimen in the format first initial last name.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation._Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight._The act of preparing or putting through a prescribed procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.:Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.:The act of preparing or putting through a prescribed procedure.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.
Pertaining to a portion of the whole; any one of two or more samples of something, of the same volume or weight.
The act of preparing or putting through a prescribed procedure.
